description: From Medieval Latin splendiferus, from Late Latin splendōrifer, from Latin splendor + -fer (“bearing”), reintroduced humorously into English c. 1837.

adjectives.description: splendiferous (comparative more splendiferous, superlative most splendiferous)

examples: […] he was trying to convince the Spaniards on the Viceroy's brig that they really ought to be interested in certain splendiferous goods that he, Mr. Foot, the owner and captain of this galleot, had of late brought out of the Orient—particularly, carpets.
